item.title: Axiom #1
item.description: Principles are important because they can make hard decisions easier. So they are useful from an efficiency standpoint. They can also serve to lower the chances of catastrophic mistakes. If you draft your principles when your mind is at rest, what you come up with will likely help protect you from emotional impulses when you are in a more tumultuous frame of mind. However I don’t think that principles are the foundation.

item.title: What do you know?
item.description: What do you know? Today, I had this exchange with a fellow fintwitter: The highlighted statement reminds me of someone who once told me: “I know that Jesus will come back” I guess people like to use the word “know” to make their convictions sound like certainties. As of today, although it’s likely that Bitcoin will play some kind of role in the future, there is nothing knowable about what that role will be.

item.title: Data Communications Management
item.description: BLUF I am not taking a position in DCM as of today. While the stock is cheap in terms of multiples, the company is in the declining printing business and they need a mini-miracle to expand out of it into digital. I do not see a clear path towards a 10 bagger in 5 years. The cannabis labeling business represents only 5% of their revenues despite their market leader position in Canada.
